instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Hello,

I got this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green light OK, chime OK, no image. I know it has booted into the OS as I can hear the volume up/down adjustment sound. When I close the lid for some minutes and open it up again, I get an image and everything works fine! What do I check? The plastic cover on <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> looks heated up. No history. No liquid damage visible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Did you touch up the solder joints on <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> yet?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: That was the first thing I did, no luck...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Known good LCD? <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD</SIGNAL> line can cause issues like this, check diode mode and connector/cable.
